name: translation_quality
description:
Is the translation of the source text accurate, fluent, comprenhencible and free of errors?
Accuracy: How well does the translation convey the original meaning and content of the source text?
Fluency: How natural and idiomatic is the translation in terms of grammar, syntax, and phrasing?
Comprehensibility: How easily can the translation be understood by a native speaker of the target language?
Errors: Are there any errors in grammar, vocabulary, punctuation, or formatting that affect the overall quality of the translation?

options.description: Nonsense/No meaning preserved: Nearly all information is lost between the translation and the source text. Grammar is irrelevant.
Some Meaning Preserved: The translation preserves some of the meaning of the source text but misses significant parts. The narrative is hard to follow due to fundamental errors. Grammar may be poor.
Most Meaning Preserved and Few Grammar Mistakes: The translation retains most of the meaning of the source text. It may have some grammar mistakes or minor contextual inconsistencies.
Perfect Meaning and Grammar: The meaning of the translation is completely consistent with the source text and the surrounding context (if applicable). The grammar is also correct.
